intro: Calonyction mollissimum var. glabrior, commonly known as the silky bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has soft, hairy leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky texture, contributing to its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and long flowering period.
